Topic: Draw two habitats and the different living things in each
Evidence Statements: The student can identify and draw two different habitats, one on land (e.g., playground, garden, forest, parking lot) and one in water (e.g., pond, stream, lake).
The student can draw a variety of living things in each habitat, such as trees, grasses, or bushes for land habitats, and fish or clams for water habitats.
The student can compare and label the different types of plants and animals found in each habitat, noting similarities and differences.
The student can organize the drawings to show patterns of plant and animal diversity in each habitat.
